Government.Name: Republic
Government.Description:
Republics are governments that are led by a head of state who is usually elected. The head of state, often called the President, serves for a set term, after which a new president is elected. While the president is elected, this may actually happen indirectly, where a council of some sort is elected by the people, and this council then elects a president. In many respects Republics are similar to Democracies and usually hold comparable ideals.
Citizens of Republics typically enjoy many freedoms and liberties. Republics invariably divide governmental power carefully between the executive, legislative and judicial areas. The president controls the executive area, while other elected representatives control the legislative area. The courts control the judicial area.

Government.Name: Mercantile Guild
Government.Description:
Mercantile Guild governments are highly focussed towards commerce, trade and industry. The ruling structure is often loose and informal – a collection of leading members of the business community make key decisions that affect all citizens.
Mercantile Guilds generally allow a high degree of freedom and autonomy to their citizens. Basic rights and liberties are guaranteed by a simple set of laws that can apply to many situations. Entrepreneurial activity is very common, creating a dynamic business environment where high levels of wealth are generated quickly.

Government.Name: Democracy
Government.Description:
Democratic governments draw their power from the people that live under them. Competitive elections are held to select representatives who rule for a specified period.
Citizens of democratic governments enjoy universally recognized freedoms and liberties including: freedom of political expression, freedom of speech and freedom of the press. Democratic governments typically also uphold other important principles such as: equality before the law, due process and civil liberties.

FeatureExplanations.string: [HL]Enterprising Spirit:[/HL] chance of a periodic random positive event that temporarily improves Research, Diplomacy, Espionage or the Military.\nOccurs approximately once every 10 years on average

Government.Name: Tribal Bloodlines
Government.Description:
Tribal Bloodlines are ruled by tribal leaders by bloodline inheritance.
Under Tribal Bloodline governments, the ruling body is composed of the various tribal and clan leaders of each prominent bloodline. Military prowess, honor through combat, and a good death are central pillars of tribal bloodline societies. Tribal Bloodline societies give heavy emphasis to might makes right. Their social structures are typically very dynamic, with different tribes or clans having a wide variety of unique customs and character. However, Everyone must submit to their local chief, or replace them.

FeatureExplanations.string: [HL]Upgraded Militia:[/HL] defending militia troops are much stronger than usual, providing better defense against invaders. When one of your colonies is conquered, any rebellion against the invaders will also produce stronger militia troops as they attempt to return to your empire
[HL]Feudal Obligation:[/HL] doubled Troop Recruitment Rate for 2 years after a war starts
[HL]Privateer Navy:[/HL] Escorts are purchased and operated by your private sector, under the supervision of clan leaders. They cannot be manually controlled

Government.Name: Monarchy
Government.Description:
Monarchies invest supreme power in an individual (the Monarch) who is the head of state, often for life or until abdication. Monarchies are usually hereditary, with a child of the Monarch inheriting power on the death of their parent.
Monarchs may rule with absolute power, or they may share power with a ruling council of nobles or elected representatives.

FeatureExplanations.string: [HL]Flag Ship:[/HL] can designate one military ship as your empire Flag ship. Flag ships have +10% Targeting, Countermeasures, Ship Maneuvering, Ship Speed and Damage Control. When your Flag ship destroys an enemy military ship of equal or greater size your empire receives a one-year happiness bonus. When your Flag ship is destroyed your empire receives a one-year happiness penalty. To assign a military ship as your Flag ship, right-click the ship for a popup menu option
[HL]Always Justified:[/HL] all wars you declare are always considered justified by your population, thus slowing the growth rate of war weariness

Government.Name: Stratocracy
Government.Description:
Stratocracy is an militaristic form of government.
Military based governments are strictly defined by military law and chain of command. Their political, social and civil structures are tuned towards military concerns such as warfare and self defense.
There is not a lot of respect for, nor tolerance of, individual expression. Art and music take the backseat to war preparation, defense training, and other military concerns.
Discipline, Loyalty, and Valor are high virtues in a Stratocratic society.

FeatureExplanations.string: [HL]War World:[/HL] can manually initiate a temporary War World event at one of your colonies for +100% boosts to Troop Recruitment, Ship Construction and Facility Construction, but with reduced colony happiness. War World lasts for two years and costs 20,000 credits to initiate

[HL]Reassuring Security:[/HL] high troop presence at your colonies adds up to +5 happiness. This colony approval factor starts when you have at least half the expected troop levels to defend the colony. Check the colony approval factors in the Selection Panel for details

Government.Name: Technocracy
Government.Description:
Technocratic governments place engineers, scientists and technical experts in control. Decision makers are selected based upon how knowledgeable and capable they are.
Technocracies are typically highly efficient and free from corruption. However they often enforce tight control over their citizen’s Behavior. This loss of personal freedom can sometimes lead to unrest.
Technocracy government type is only available to the Ackdarians.

Government.Name: Hive Mind
Government.Description:
Hive Mind governments can be formed by alien races that have a natural telepathic ability. The prime value is loyalty to the community as a whole – individual expression and freedom is suppressed for this greater common good.
In Hive Minds all work is divided amongst distinct social castes. Some castes are responsible for food production, others for defense, while others care for administration. In some alien societies even reproduction is specialized to a small caste, with one or more “queens” producing each new generation.
Hive Mind government type is only available to the Boskara race.

FeatureExplanations.string: [HL]Intuitive Jumps:[/HL] Hyperjump accuracy doubled when exiting a jump at a location where your empire has an established presence (colony or base)
[HL]War Spawning:[/HL] Population growth rate increases by +50% during war time

Government.Name: Shadow Republic
Government.Description:
Shadow Republics present one face to its own people, but a very different face to the rest of the galaxy.
Shadow Republics are manipulated by savvy and shrewd politicians for personal gain at the expense of the common good. Often, the real power is not represented in its government halls at all, only being a facade and a show to placate the masses.
The real government is controlled by powerful entities that prefer to remain in the shadows, and unknown to most. To know the real faces of power is to live in terror, or in their back pockets.

Government.Name: Archivist
Government.Description:
Archivist governments are obsessed with information. The type of information makes no difference to this government. All information that exists must be known and archived in the vast data vaults of the empire.
Archivists, while competent in intellectual pursuits, have great disdain for manual labor. The value of new information is often traded in the same fashion as currency in this society.
